snippet: Critics say a decree by President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia that bans all political rallies in Monrovia to prevent the further spread of Ebola is really an attempt to ensure victory for her son’s Senate campaign.
abstract: Anger builds over decree by Liberian Pres Ellen Johnson Sirleaf banning all political rallies in Monrovia in attempt to prevent further spread of Ebola; critics allege that true motive was to promote victory for Sirleaf's son Robert in hotly contested Senate race.

byline.original: By CLAIR MacDOUGALL and SHERI FINK
byline.contributor: Clair MacDougall reported from Monrovia, and Sheri Fink from New York, Monrovia and Lofa County, Liberia.

lead_paragraph: Critics say a decree by President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia that bans all political rallies in Monrovia to prevent the further spread of Ebola is really an attempt to ensure victory for her son’s Senate campaign.

headline.main: Liberian President’s Ban on Rallies Is Seen as Political
